intro: Salsola ptiloptera, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has small, spiny leaves and produces clusters of greenish-yellow flowers. It is well adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate high levels of salinity. Salsola ptiloptera plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in desert regions.
